item.title: Brexit: Johnson 'very confident' MPs will back deal
item.description: The PM is facing an uphill battle to get his new Brexit deal through the House of Commons on Saturday.

item.title: Brexit: What is in Boris Johnson's new deal with the EU?
item.description: A revised Brexit deal has been agreed by the UK and EU. What does it contain?

item.title: Brexit: Nigel Dodds says Boris Johnson is 'too eager to get deal'
item.description: The DUP says it will not support the PM's plan for NI as it has concerns about customs and consent.

item.title: Duke and Duchess: Royal plane aborts landing after Pakistan storms
item.description: An RAF aircraft carrying the Duke and Duchess of Cambridge twice tried to land in Islamabad.

item.title: Kevin McCloud property firms face liquidation
item.description: People lent thousands of pounds to a company which was founded by the Grand Designs presenter.

item.title: Drayton Manor to be prosecuted over Evha Jannath's death
item.description: Evha Jannath, 11, died after falling from Drayton Manor's Splash Canyon water ride in 2017.

item.title: Paul Gascoigne cleared of sex assault on train passenger
item.description: The ex-footballer has been cleared of both assault and sexual assault after kissing a woman on a train.

item.title: E-fit released to identify man who fell from plane
item.description: The body of a man, believed to be Kenyan, was found in a garden in Clapham in June.

item.title: Extinction Rebellion protesters dragged from Tube train roof
item.description: Extinction Rebellion says it will "take stock" of the reaction to the action for future protests.

item.title: Four Bulgaria fans banned over racist abuse
item.description: Four of the fans arrested by Bulgarian police for subjecting England players to racist abuse are fined and banned.

item.title: The Troubles: Former IRA man Ivor Bell cleared of Jean McConville charges
item.description: Ivor Bell had been charged with soliciting the murder of mother-of-10 Jean McConville in 1972.

item.title: Brexit: What happens now?
item.description: The British government and the EU have agreed a new Brexit deal, but will it get through Parliament?

item.title: Brexit deal: What does it mean?
item.description: Boris Johnson has agreed a new Brexit deal with the EU - but what does it mean and will Parliament pass it?

item.title: Brexit deal: Where have the UK and EU compromised?
item.description: After tense negotiations, both sides made concessions to reach a new deal.

item.title: Legal bid at Court of Session to stop MPs passing 'illegal' Brexit deal
item.description: Anti-Brexit campaigner Jo Maugham has lodged a petition at Scotland's highest civil court.

item.title: Prince William and Kate bowl over royal fans on Pakistan tour
item.description: The Duke and Duchess of Cambridge take to the crease on the fourth day of their visit to the country.

item.title: Harry Dunn death: Is extraditing Anne Sacoolas a realistic prospect?
item.description: What are the legal options that might provide Harry Dunn's parents with the details of his death?

item.title: The Derbyshire village recreated out of fruit cake
item.description: A baker spent three months constructing the sweet model of Eyam village in Derbyshire.

item.title: Which crimes are least likely to be solved?
item.description: Many crimes in the UK remain unsolved and many are not even reported - details in 10 charts.

item.title: My Money: 'BOOM, suddenly £14.99 less rich!'
item.description: As part of a new BBC blog series, Olivia Davies shares what she's spent her money on this week.

item.title: Tricky's 'world was over' when his daughter Mazy died
item.description: The rapper and actor's memoirs reveal his struggle with anxiety after his daughter's death.

item.title: Brexit: What have been the sticking points?
item.description: A revised Brexit deal, acceptable to both UK and EU negotiators, remains elusive. What have been the main sticking points?

item.title: Charles Jencks: The architect who made cancer care a work of art
item.description: Charles Jencks believed the design of the centres inspired by his wife, Maggie, should lift the spirits of patients.

item.title: Stormzy's Merky Books will publish Malorie Blackman's autobiography
item.description: The Noughts and Crosses author is already published by Penguin Random House, which runs Merky Books.

item.title: Unmanned ship to go on 400-year-old journey across the Atlantic
item.description: UK-based team to chart unprecedented waters with fully autonomous sea journey.

item.title: BBC 100 Women 2019: Who is on the list this year?
item.description: Our most inspiring and influential women of 2019 give us their vision of a female-led future.

item.title: Michel Barnier confirms new Brexit deal reached
item.description: EU chief Brexit negotiator Michel Barnier announces a new deal between the UK and EU has been agreed.

item.title: BA passengers: Cabin fumes affected our health
item.description: Passengers on a British Airways flight that filled with smoke mid-air say they're still having breathing difficulties two months on.

item.title: Headway Suffolk Brainy Dogs scheme 'gave me my best friend'
item.description: Rescue dog Bee is helping people recovering from brain injury gain confidence.

item.title: Ballet star Precious Adams on balancing roles with being a role model
item.description: Rising star of English ballet Precious Adams on unwittingly opening up a debate around colourism.

item.title: Trump 'spoke with Boris' before meeting Dunn's parents
item.description: The president said the PM asked him to arrange a meeting between the 19-year-old’s parents and Mrs Sacoolas.

item.title: Harry Dunn: 'Not right' to meet Sacoolas at White House
item.description: Harry Dunn's parents refused the US president's offer to meet a woman who was involved in his death.

item.title: Taunton 'stolen' car crash kills driver during police pursuit
item.description: The driver was fatally injured when the car overturned and burst into flames in Taunton.

item.title: Nicola Sturgeon says Johnson deal would mean 'much harder Brexit'
item.description: Scotland's first minister confirms her SNP MPs will vote against Boris Johnson's newly-agreed deal with the EU.

item.title: Brexit deal: Why does the DUP's opinion matter?
item.description: BBC News NI assesses the new Brexit deal, why the DUP won't vote for it and why that matters.

item.title: Brexit deal would make Wales poorer - Mark Drakeford
item.description: The first minister says the new agreement would do "untold damage" to the Welsh economy.

item.title: Simon Smith: Triple baby killer moved to open prison
item.description: The mother of one of Simon Smith's victims says she is "devastated" and "horrified" by the decision.
